root.title: 25 The Lower Inegen
root.place: The inscription found in district Kyzyl-Telan in 5 km from mouth of river Lower Inegen (Nizhnii Inegen) on left coast.
root.description: Written on broken slate plate of size 71 x 41 cm. The horizontal line consists of 9 or 10 signs.
root.size: Length is 18.5 cm, signs’ height is between 2 and 5,5 cm.
root.investigation: Matochkin found in 2005. Publication: Kocheev 523.

pdf.f_title: Свод древнетюркских рунических памятников Горного Алтая. Горно-Алтайск: АКИН, 2006. – 52 с.

refs.ref: Кызласов И.Л. Рунические письменности евразийских степей.-М. 1994.-С. 318.-Рис. 18.
